member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.Base
member.summary: Base class for all openssl wrapped objects. Contains the raw unmanaged pointer and has a Handle property to get access to it. Also overloads the ToString() method with a BIO print.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Base.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor which takes the raw unmanged pointer. This is the only way to construct this object and all dervied types.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Base.Print(OpenSSL.Core.BIO)
member.summary: This method is used by the ToString() implementation. A great number of openssl objects support printing, so this is a conveinence method. Dervied types should override this method and not ToString().
member.param: The BIO stream object to print into

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Base.ToString
member.summary: Override of ToString() which uses Print() into a BIO memory buffer.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Base.OnDispose
member.summary: This method must be implemented in derived classes.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Base.OnNewHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Do nothing in the base class.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Base.Dispose
member.summary: Implementation of the IDisposable interface. If the native pointer is not null, we haven't been disposed, and we are the owner, then call the virtual OnDispose() method.

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Core.Base.owner
member.summary: If this object is the owner, then call the appropriate native free function.

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Core.Base.isDisposed
member.summary: This is to prevent double-deletion issues.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.Base.IsOwner
member.summary: gets/sets whether the object owns the Native pointer

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.Base.Handle
member.summary: Access to the raw unmanaged pointer.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.BaseValueType
member.summary: Helper base class that handles the AddRef() method by using a _dup() method.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BaseValueType.DuplicateHandle
member.summary: Derived classes must use a _dup() method to make a copy of the underlying native data structure.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.BaseReferenceType
member.summary: Helper type that handles the AddRef() method. Derived classes must implement the LockType and RawReferenceType properties

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BaseReferenceType.PrintRefCount
member.summary: Prints the current underlying reference count

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.BaseReferenceType.LockType
member.summary: Derived classes must return a CryptoLockTypes for this type

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.BaseReferenceType.RawReferenceType
member.summary: Derived classes must return a Type that matches the underlying type

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BIO.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calls BIO_new_mem_buf() from the specified buffer.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BIO.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Calls BIO_new_mem_buf() from the specified string.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BIO.MemoryBuffer
member.summary: Factory method that calls BIO_new() with BIO_s_mem()

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BIO.MessageDigest(OpenSSL.Crypto.MessageDigest)
member.summary: Factory method that calls BIO_new() with BIO_f_md()

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BIO.GetMessageDigestContext
member.summary: Returns the MessageDigestContext if this BIO's type if BIO_f_md()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.BIO.BytesPending
member.summary: Returns number of bytes buffered in the BIO - calls BIO_ctrl_pending

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.MemoryTracker
member.summary: Useful for tracking down memory leaks

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.MemoryTracker.Finish
member.summary: Stops memory tracking and reports any leaks found since Start() was called.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.MemoryTracker.Leaked
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes leaked between Start() and Finish()

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.Cipher.Print(OpenSSL.Core.BIO)
member.summary: Prints the LongName of this cipher.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.Cipher.OnDispose
member.summary: Not implemented, these objects should never be disposed

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.Cipher.LongName
member.summary: Returns the long name for the nid field using OBJ_nid2ln()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.Cipher.Name
member.summary: Returns the name for the nid field using OBJ_nid2sn()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.Cipher.TypeName
member.summary: Returns the long name for the type using OBJ_nid2ln()

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Crypto.Envelope
member.summary: Simple struct to encapsulate common parameters for crypto functions

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Crypto.Envelope.Keys
member.summary: The key for a crypto operation

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.CipherContext.#ctor(OpenSSL.Crypto.Cipher)
member.summary: Calls OPENSSL_malloc() and initializes the buffer using EVP_CIPHER_CTX_init()

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.CipherContext.Crypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encrypts or decrypts the specified payload.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.CipherContext.Cipher
member.summary: Returns the EVP_CIPHER for this context.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509V3Context.SetNoDB
member.summary: X509V3_set_ctx_nodb - sets the db pointer to NULL

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.Configuration.ApplyExtensions(System.String,OpenSSL.X509.X509Certificate,OpenSSL.X509.X509Certificate,OpenSSL.X509.X509Request)
member.summary: Creates a X509v3Context(), calls X509V3_set_ctx() on it, then calls X509V3_EXT_add_nconf()

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey
member.summary: Wraps the native OpenSSL EVP_PKEY object

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey.Print(OpenSSL.Core.BIO)
member.summary: Calls appropriate Print() based on the type.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey.KeyType
member.summary: Set of types that this CryptoKey can be.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH
member.summary: Encapsulates the native openssl Diffie-Hellman functions (DH_*)

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.FromParameters(System.String)
member.summary: Factory method that calls FromParametersPEM() to deserialize a DH object from a PEM-formatted string.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.FromParametersPEM(OpenSSL.Core.BIO)
member.summary: Factory method that calls PEM_read_bio_DHparams() to deserialize a DH object from a PEM-formatted string using the BIO interface.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.FromParametersDER(OpenSSL.Core.BIO)
member.summary: Factory method that calls XXX() to deserialize a DH object from a DER-formatted buffer using the BIO interface.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.WriteParametersDER(OpenSSL.Core.BIO)
member.summary: Calls ASN1_i2d_bio() with the i2d = i2d_DHparams().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.PEM
member.summary: Creates a BIO.MemoryBuffer(), calls WriteParametersPEM() into this buffer, then returns the buffer as a string.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.DER
member.summary: Creates a BIO.MemoryBuffer(), calls WriteParametersDER() into this buffer, then returns the buffer.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.NoExpConstantTime
member.summary: Sets or clears the FlagNoExpConstTime bit in the flags field.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Crypto.DH.CheckCode
member.summary: Flags for the return value of DH_check().

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.DSA.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: If both objects have a private key, those are compared. Otherwise just the params and public keys are compared.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.DSA.GetHashCode
member.summary: Xor of the params, public key, and optionally the private key

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.DSA.PublicKeyAsPEM
member.summary: Returns the pub_key field as a PEM string

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.DSA.PrivateKeyAsPEM
member.summary: Returns the priv_key field as a PEM string

member.name: T:OpenSSL.X509.Identity
member.summary: Simple encapsulation of a local identity. This includes the private key and the X509Certificate.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.Identity.#ctor(OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey)
member.summary: Construct an Identity with a private key

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.Identity.CreateRequest(System.String)
member.summary: Create a X509Request for this identity, using the specified name.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.Identity.CreateRequest(System.String,OpenSSL.Crypto.MessageDigest)
member.summary: Create a X509Request for this identity, using the specified name and digest.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.Identity.VerifyResponse(OpenSSL.X509.X509Chain,System.String@)
member.summary: Verify that the specified chain can be trusted.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.Identity.PublicKey
member.summary: Returns the embedded public key of the X509Certificate

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Crypto.MessageDigest.OnDispose
member.summary: Not implemented, these objects should never be disposed.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.MessageDigest.LongName
member.summary: Returns the type field using OBJ_nid2ln()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Crypto.MessageDigest.Name
member.summary: Returns the type field using OBJ_nid2sn()

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.ThreadInitialization
member.summary: static class for initialize OpenSSL/Crypto libraries for threading

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.Native
member.summary: This is the low-level C-style interface to the crypto API. Use this interface with caution.

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Core.Native.DLLNAME
member.summary: This is the name of the DLL that P/Invoke loads and tries to bind all of these native functions to.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.Native.SSL_CTX_get_options(System.IntPtr)
member.returns: Int32 representation of options set in the context

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.OpenSslError
member.summary: This is a struct that contains a uint for the native openssl error code. It provides helper methods to convert this error code into strings.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.OpenSslException
member.summary: Exception class to provide OpenSSL specific information when errors occur.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.OpenSslException.#ctor
member.summary: When this class is instantiated, GetErrorMessage() is called automatically. This will call ERR_get_error() on the native openssl interface, once for every error that is in the current context. The exception message is the concatination of each of these errors turned into strings using ERR_error_string_n().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.OpenSslException.Errors
member.summary: Returns the list of errors associated with this exception.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.PasswordHandler
member.summary: Callback prototype. Must return the password or prompt for one.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.PasswordCallback
member.summary: Simple password callback that returns the contained password.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.PasswordCallback.OnPassword(System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Suitable callback to be used as a PasswordHandler

member.summary: Create an SslStream based on an existing stream.

member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

member.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous read to complete.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SSL.SslStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SSL.SslStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SSL.SslStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the current stream and releases any resources (such as sockets and file handles) associated with the current stream.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.SSL.SslStream.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Indicates whether data sent using this SslStream is encrypted.

member.summary: Indicates whether both server and client have been authenticated.

member.summary: Indicates whether the local side of the connection was authenticated as the server.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.SSL.SslStream.IsSigned
member.summary: Indicates whether the data sent using this stream is signed.

member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of the stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets the position within the current stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in miliseconds, that determines how long the stream will attempt to read before timing out.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.SSL.SslStream.WriteTimeout

member.summary: Constructs a FileSerialNumber. The path specifies where the serial number should be read and written to.

member.summary: Implements the Next() method of the ISequenceNumber interface. The sequence number is read from a file, incremented, then written back to the file

member.summary: Returns the next available sequence number. This implementation simply increments the current sequence number and returns it.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.X509.X509CertificateAuthority

member.summary: Returns a Certificate if the type is X509_LU_X509

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509Object.PrivateKey
member.summary: Returns the PrivateKey if the type is X509_LU_PKEY

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.#ctor(System.Int32,OpenSSL.X509.X509Name,OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey)
member.summary: Calls X509_REQ_new() and then initializes version, subject, and key.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a X509_REQ from a PEM formatted string.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.Sign(OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey,OpenSSL.Crypto.MessageDigest)
member.summary: Sign this X509Request using the supplied key and digest.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.Verify(OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey)
member.summary: Verify this X509Request against the supplied key.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.CreateCertificate(System.Int32,OpenSSL.Crypto.CryptoKey)
member.summary: Converts this request into a certificate using X509_REQ_to_X509().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.Version
member.summary: Accessor to the version field. The settor calls X509_REQ_set_version().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.PublicKey
member.summary: Accessor to the pubkey field. Uses X509_REQ_get_pubkey() and X509_REQ_set_pubkey()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.Subject
member.summary: Accessor to the subject field. Setter calls X509_REQ_set_subject_name().

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509Request.PEM
member.summary: Returns the PEM formatted string for this object.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the X509Store object with a pre-existing native X509_STORE pointer

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.#ctor(OpenSSL.X509.X509Chain)
member.summary: Calls X509_STORE_new() and then adds the specified chain as trusted.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.#ctor(OpenSSL.X509.X509Chain,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calls X509_STORE_new() and then adds the specified chaing as trusted.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.Verify(OpenSSL.X509.X509Certificate,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns the trusted state of the specified certificate

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.AddTrusted(OpenSSL.X509.X509Chain)
member.summary: Adds a chain to the trusted list.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.AddTrusted(OpenSSL.X509.X509Certificate)
member.summary: Adds a certificate to the trusted list, calls X509_STORE_add_cert()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509Store.Objects
member.summary: Wraps the objs member on the raw X509_STORE structure

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509StoreContext.Error
member.summary: Getter returns X509_STORE_CTX_get_error(), setter calls X509_STORE_CTX_set_error()

member.name: P:OpenSSL.X509.X509StoreContext.Store
member.summary: Returns an X509Store based on this context

member.name: T:OpenSSL.SSL.SslContext
member.summary: Wraps the SST_CTX structure and methods

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SSL.SslContext.SetCertificateStore(OpenSSL.X509.X509Store)
member.summary: Sets the certificate store for the context - calls SSL_CTX_set_cert_store The X509Store object and contents will be freed when the context is disposed. Ensure that the store object and it's contents have IsOwner set to false before assigning them into the context.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SSL.SslContext.SetVerify(OpenSSL.SSL.VerifyMode,OpenSSL.SSL.RemoteCertificateValidationHandler)
member.summary: Sets the certificate verification mode and callback - calls SSL_CTX_set_verify

member.name: M:OpenSSL.SSL.SslContext.SetVerifyDepth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the certificate verification depth - calls SSL_CTX_set_verify_depth

member.name: P:OpenSSL.SSL.SslContext.CAList
member.summary: Calls SSL_CTX_set_client_CA_list/SSL_CTX_get_client_CA_list The Stack and the X509Name objects contined within them are freed when the context is disposed. Make sure that the Stack and X509Name objects have set IsOwner to false before assigning them to the context.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.SSL.SslMethod
member.summary: Wraps the SSL_METHOD structure and methods

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber
member.summary: Wraps the BN_* set of functions.

member.name: F:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.One
member.summary: Creates a BigNumber object by calling BN_value_one()

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.#ctor(OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber)
member.summary: Calls BN_dup() on the BigNumber passed in.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a BigNumber by calling BN_set_word()

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.op_Implicit(System.UInt32)~OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber
member.summary: Creates a new BigNumber object from a uint.

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.op_Equality(OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber,OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber)
member.summary: Determines if lhs is by-value equal to rhs

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.op_Inequality(OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber,OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber)
member.summary: Determines if lhs is by-value different than rhs

member.name: M:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.GetHashCode
member.summary: Creates a hash code by converting this object to a decimal string and returns the hash code of that string.

member.name: P:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.Bytes
member.summary: Converts the result of Bits into the number of bytes.

member.name: T:OpenSSL.Core.BigNumber.GeneratorHandler
member.summary: Generator callback. Used mostly for status indications for long- running generator functions.
